name: py-mne

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: MNE python project for MEG and EEG data analysis.

dependencies.name: py-decorator
dependencies.description:
The aim of the decorator module it to simplify the usage of decorators
for the average programmer, and to popularize decorators by showing
various non-trivial examples.

dependencies.name: py-dipy
dependencies.description:
Diffusion MRI utilities in python. DIPY is the paragon 3D/4D+ imaging
library in Python. Contains generic methods for spatial normalization,
signal processing, machine learning, statistical analysis and
visualization of medical images. Additionally, it contains specialized
methods for computational anatomy including diffusion, perfusion and
structural imaging.

dependencies.name: py-h5io
dependencies.description: Python Objects Onto HDF5.

dependencies.name: py-h5py
dependencies.description:
The h5py package provides both a high- and low-level interface to the
HDF5 library from Python.

dependencies.name: py-imageio
dependencies.description:
Python library for reading and writing image data. Imageio is a Python
library that provides an easy interface to read and write a wide range
of image data, including animated images, video, volumetric data, and
scientific formats. It is cross-platform, runs on Python 2.7 and 3.4+,
and is easy to install.

dependencies.name: py-imageio-ffmpeg
dependencies.description:
The purpose of this project is to provide a simple and reliable ffmpeg
wrapper for working with video files. It implements two simple generator
functions for reading and writing data from/to ffmpeg, which reliably
terminate the ffmpeg process when done. It also takes care of publishing
platform-specific wheels that include the binary ffmpeg executables.

dependencies.name: py-importlib-resources
dependencies.description: Read resources from Python packages

dependencies.name: py-ipyvtk-simple
dependencies.description: ipywidget for vtkRenderWindow.

dependencies.name: py-ipywidgets
dependencies.description: IPython widgets for the Jupyter Notebook

dependencies.name: py-jinja2
dependencies.description:
Jinja2 is a template engine written in pure Python. It provides a Django
inspired non-XML syntax but supports inline expressions and an optional
sandboxed environment.

dependencies.name: py-joblib
dependencies.description: Lightweight pipelining with Python functions.

dependencies.name: py-jupyter
dependencies.description: Jupyter metapackage. Install all the Jupyter components in one go.

dependencies.name: py-lazy-loader
dependencies.description: lazy_loader makes it easy to load subpackages and functions on demand.

dependencies.name: py-matplotlib
dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependencies.name: py-mayavi
dependencies.description: Mayavi: 3D visualization of scientific data in Python.

dependencies.name: py-mffpy
dependencies.description: Reader and Writer for Philips' MFF file format.

dependencies.name: py-nibabel
dependencies.description: Access a multitude of neuroimaging data formats

dependencies.name: py-nilearn
dependencies.description: Statistical learning for neuroimaging in Python.

dependencies.name: py-numba
dependencies.description: NumPy aware dynamic Python compiler using LLVM

dependencies.name: py-numexpr
dependencies.description: Fast numerical expression evaluator for NumPy

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-packaging
dependencies.description: Core utilities for Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pooch
dependencies.description:
Pooch manages your Python library's sample data files: it automatically
downloads and stores them in a local directory, with support for
versioning and corruption checks.

dependencies.name: py-psutil
dependencies.description:
psutil is a cross-platform library for retrieving information on running
processes and system utilization (CPU, memory, disks, network) in
Python.

dependencies.name: py-pymatreader
dependencies.description: Convenient reader for Matlab mat files.

dependencies.name: py-pyqt5
dependencies.description:
PyQt is a set of Python v2 and v3 bindings for The Qt Company's Qt
application framework and runs on all platforms supported by Qt
including Windows, OS X, Linux, iOS and Android. PyQt5 supports Qt v5.

dependencies.name: py-pyqt5-sip
dependencies.description: The sip module support for PyQt5.

dependencies.name: py-pysurfer
dependencies.description: Cortical neuroimaging visualization in Python.

dependencies.description: Preconditoned ICA for Real Data.

dependencies.description: A set of python modules for machine learning and data mining.

dependencies.name: py-scipy

A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.

dependencies.name: py-sip
dependencies.description: A Python bindings generator for C/C++ libraries.
